s9a1I5a0y8R_JQe58atNNg.text: Needed a quick dinner before a show and decided to give this a try. It was stupid delicious! I had the duck waffle, my wife had duck satay, our son had a duck burger. All of them were bloody good.

PVwJC8P2D9IbpIxWJLRowQ.text: Duck burger was delicious. Wife and I both got the burger and we both loved it. I'll definitely be back!

SZ0bIE25KnvmM7dAFk-FoQ.text: This restaurant was alright. I had the duck and waffle as the name recommends. The duck was flavorful. The waffle tasted like normal waffles. The mustard maple syrup was alright. It would have been better had the mustard seeds had not simply been thrown into it. My friend had the duck burger. It was alright and tasted like a normal burger. Nothing special. The restaurant was alright. I would go back simply to try other menu options.

qxEG7JySd9a1DgxCNaSlaw.text: Awesome food and service. We got the duck and waffle and the duck burger and both were awesome. Full of flavor. Would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

3KCcMEx9vYr4NbIW58bB5w.text: This place is delightful. The service was amazing, the food was delicious, easy to get seated on a Sunday evening, clean, accommodating with our baby...not one thing was off. Husband and I split the Brussels sprouts and the duck fat fries for appetizers and then ordered a duck burger and the pumpkin ravioli. Not one thing was bad. The duck burger was so incredible!! This is the second location to regular duck and waffle but I think it's just as good!!

w2uwFzJSQ1RNnjDvziVzPQ.text: It is slightly weird to have the next table about 10cm away from yours. Slightly on the more expensive side. Duck is nicely cooked. Definitely easier to get a table than at the big brother location but of course missing the view. If you want to impress a date go big and book a table at the high rise location instead.

gGmeag0PcNR2cSCpNYQXUQ.text: Surprisingly good duck and waffle place. Would come again if I am in the neighborhood. Very good service too.

TAusvyx78X-nafOjbK0Csw.text: Super yum breakfast and great dining placeBut service is not up to five stars

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

aMPhHPCYL0jcHm1mEXMTRw.text: Very much enjoyed the mushroom ravioli, duck fat fries, polenta balls, spicy buns, and duck and waffle. Good service, good food.

XZvPsNQ9mLbIT2fH4mnA5w.text: The food was nothing out of the ordinary. Instead of a fried chicken it's fried duck and waffles. The duck on the duck and waffle was over cooked and dried. How do you overcook duck? The duck tongues were not properly cleaned. Service was terrible. Our hostess, Radka, was rude, unprofessional and impatient. Seems like there is a different vibe from her when it wasn't a group of white customers. She never came to check in with us as she did with all the other table with white customers. Overall I'm pretty disappointed with duck & waffle given how much hype there is around this place. My recommendation, don't bother. There's better duck elsewhere (up the street really)

feUu4osXehDRrEDWCdkH3A.text: Nice place, specially for a late night meal after watching a play around Piccadilly Circus. We had the duck and gluten free waffle, the burger and the foie gras. The burger was by far the most innovative and interesting of them all. Foie gras was tasty, but it got a bit monotonous after a few bites. The duck and waffle was not unique or particularly interesting - not sure why it is the dish that give name to the restaurant. The drinks were really tasty -- we had the mojito and the seasonal spritzer. Service was impeccable: attentive, fast and friendly.

lyjbeyLmGsc2NfttmsT30w.text: Everyone kept telling us to go to the main Duck and Waffle but reservations were just ridiculous.  Luckily we were here on our honeymoon and this lovely place had just opened up in the area. We totally lucked out as we thought we would leave London without trying this place. They have most of the famous dishes here but don't expect the same type of service. This place is a bit more of an express version but that's the whole point. It's catering for those people who either can't get reservations or don't want to trek out to the east side. Either way, believe the hype, the food here was great and really as good as people say it is.

YaP2xfFHvkYiyZXMjKunCg.text: I had the best experience eating at Duck & Waffle Local.  The duck burger was the highlight of my trip to London.  Hands down the best burger! The staff was tremendously friendly and recommended for us to try the crispy pig ears, which were phenomenal.  We also had the duck & waffle with the most delicious mustard maple syrup.  YUMMMM! All the cocktails were super tasty as well.  I wish I lived in London so I could eat here more often.  A must visit for all!

svk5Ri2SfrqufMG8oVld1A.text: Duck and waffle was delicious.  Beet salad thumbs up.  We enjoyed the foie gras crime brûlée and duck jam donut.  We also had broccoli and brussel sprout.  Broccoli was normal but Brussels sprouts are more like deep fried and not roasted.  I could not have a second bite.  Overall, it was a good meal.

NY7v54KowCaL-pKcEN6wGg.text: This was totally delicious! I recommend getting the chips as well as the duck and waffle. They were great. We also had a dessert waffle--the brownie--which was good but not as fudgy as I thought it would be. A short walk from the Churchill War Rooms or the Changing of the Queen's Life Guard.

yc4AnGB90jwvKNSjkOsCKg.text: This is the hands down favorite place we ate when we were in London. From the pig ears, gizzards, satay, flatbread, and of course, the Duck & Waffle- all things duck were excellent.

xnn2PcQUkI-kN65nHJm7JA.text: Very disappointing experience here. The kitchen is open and one of the cooks was eating the food while he was cooking. Shared this with management and they said it was food testing, though they ultimately said it was wrong. No comp on the lunch. Low class.

KRP3VuEG_BqdVepclOLP6A.text: Love this restaurant. Ordered the duck burger and full Elvis desert. Both were excellent. Great food, fun drinks and affordable prices! Amazing, fast, friendly service.

5fwoy-o6eyGLP-gAJgMFDQ.text: Sooooo good! I don't even like duck - we came here for my husband. But it was DELICIOUS! I got the Vietnamese salad with crispy duck, and my husband got the Duck and Waffle. Both were excellent! Service was great too!

DvUTfV4oQYfUfASwZCXWTw.text: Could eat the duck sausage every day.   But the Colombian eggs were amazing.   Will be my first stop on my next trip to London.

2Lb_sB-fZyzr6YCQJZ5KqQ.text: For those who've always wanted to try the ever-so fancy duck & waffle but never got the chance to book a reservation or are too intimidated by the sheer extravagance of it all, try duck & waffle local! The menu is not too big but it has the famous duck & waffle dish, which is a must for any duck fan! The waffle is pretty standard in my opinion but the duck confit itself is the main attraction. The crispiness of the duck was what takes the cake for me. It was the right amount of flavor, and especially in addition to the fried duck egg and the waffle, everything was a good mix of texture and taste. My only thing is that the meat itself was a lot drier than I'd like, but it was merely a preference thing. Service was friendly and quick. In order to speed things up, as it can get very busy in there, you order first before a staff directs you to an open seat. We came right before lunch so there was no wait at all so I do recommend going offpeak hours just in case! Overall, I definitely enjoyed my experience here and would definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a quality and decently priced meal in central London!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck & waffle, rosemary duck fat fries, and a millennial mojito!

mELB4wqSKlkB9aedw1vkmQ.text: I came out of town from Chicago and I absolutely loved everything. Our waitress Elea was very kind and the duck waffles were fantastic.

CWA-rimVYFE-k0z7Qt-8zQ.text: Friendly Staff, Great Strong Drinks, Good Vegetarian Options! Elvis Waffle Instant Eat...Whoosh-Gone!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Wicked Cool Plumbing!
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Elvis Waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Bitter Yum Orange

p1rtEdPV_DEvRK1CeXNVxA.text: We were greeted by a friendly gent who seated us immediately. The ambiance is very nice with the open patio and we were excited to eat there because it was recommended by a friend. The waitress, however, changed her attitude towards us as soon as we opened our mouths and she figured out we are Americans. The menu is fairly small with few choices. I ordered two eggs any style and toast and I asked for the eggs over easy. When she acted puzzled, I changed the style to fried. She continued to act puzzled and asked me if I wanted them fried or poached. I repeated fried and she asked the same question again. I then told her that they could poach them. She then repeated to me poached and proceeded to make a face as though I was crazy. We were hardly attended to the entire meal and after 4 ignored attempts over the time of 15 minutes to flag her down to get our check, we were finally able to pay and leave. Needless to say, we did not add any additional service tip like we normally do and I'm quite sure that she believes Americans are stingy. The highlight of the meal was the duck and waffle that my husband ordered. Everything else was just par and not spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

Z53uXZmG4l9YV1punRopqA.text: Searching for a place for dinner/ light meal after our show at the Criterion Theatre we came upon this place.  Upon entering we were greeted by the management team, who ushered us in to this new location.  Extremely friendly wait staff , prompt service , & very hospitable‼. We ordered 2 sides, a main , 3 pints,& and a dessert all for 38.16£!   I want to share that it's rare that places dazzle me with service and food quality, but this place was so on point that I took the time to add their profile.  Good establishments need to be supported, so add this place next time your near Leicester Square and enjoy !

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Clean bathrooms - great job management !!
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Even duckies want a pint & Get thirsty
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. The full Elvis dessert \ OMGosh save room!!

EL0mH3ENf6l4Pyle8dH1BQ.text: Firstly.. The filter coffee is bottomless!!I ordered the duck burger my friend ordered the classic duck and waffle. Both meals were succulent and quite sweet. Although the raw ramen in the burger was really pretty to look at, it doesn't really add any flavour to the whole meal. More so texture and crunch. Also ordered the broccoli and duck fat chips. The chips were good but the broccoli was a little bleurgh in comparison to the amazing main dishes. Overall really delicious and yummy place to go for lunch/dinner or even casual drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck burger with raw ramen
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Tenderstem broccoli

Ax71x_zDrnRJ2Bg1wititQ.text: A very surprising Restaurant, amazing good and speculative view from 41 floor!

kyIkZLKrf47A-umxE0x_pw.text: Waffle cook well. Duck is deep fried, lack of salt. Skewers of lamb is not dry. Shrimp sandwiches is spicy because of the chills, creamy Thai spice is great.Most importantly: order foie gras creme brûlée

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Foie gras cream brulee. We have foie gras 4 consecutive days in Paris. This is still good!

7r_AD6lZTrj3ZBOWZoCXbw.text: Hands down one of my favorite places in London!! If you can't get reservations at the original Duck & Waffles, this is just a more casual version without the view- and I heard it was cheaper too. Their foiegras creme brûlée is my absolute favorite. Ugh I'm back in California after my trip, and I still can't stop thinking about it. I tried their signature duck and waffle as well. The Duck was cooked well and is very tender. I also shared the duck gizzards with my best Aussie mate since she has never tried that before, and she loved it!

Pk8RtDIkrL3Krd3nq-0nqA.text: Yummy brunch at Duck & Waffle. We tried the Elvis waffle, the duck burger (which I don't think I'd order again, although my husband really liked it), and the duck fat fries (delicious).

evgdao8h7IFK8ZLAzeIjGQ.text: Loved this spot for breakfast! Came on a Sunday morning around 9:15, not too crowded, we were among the first patrons of the day. We had the duck beni, duck and waffles and foie gras creme brulee (to share). I was obsessed with the creme brulee. It was a pretty rich breakfast, but was really happy. Freshly squeezed orange juice was nice and coffee was good. Service was probably more like a 4/5 but it was first thing on a Sunday and they weren't quite fully staffed yet. Manager was very attentive and made up for it. Decor was great and felt open and contemporary. Perfect way to start our day in London before doing some sightseeing.

jsJ_wxkzrZSHE1q5_i8LIg.text: A nice take on the old US southern chicken and waffle idea and making it much better with duck! The duck egg on top was a masterful move. I also had the foie gras custard which was out-of-this-world! The sweetness of the burnt sugar went perfectly with the richness of the foie gras. A really bad idea to have all that food for one person but I just couldn't help myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

KwYR_G0A_9ZYIR7GvgB9OA.text: The service was prompt (and a bit abrupt without pleasantries). The food was wonderful, we ordered the ravioli and chicken satay. The portion sizes are on the small size so keep that in mind for big eaters or if you're very hungry. My only complaint is having to pay for still water. I realize that is the norm in many places, but I still find it in bad taste.

2ZaOocIoZgKmFBeDODAQGg.text: My wife knows that duck puts me in a better mode and she decided to take me here. I told her if the duck was good I'd give her a massage when we got home. We were seated immediately and placed our order quick since the duck smell made me drool. Food came out quickly and tasted delicious. We both ordered the duck and waffle. Would give it a 5 star if the portions were slightly bigger.

LgGcOwPPHBNsht4tHsasuQ.text: The food here was very good. I would definitely come back here for dinner when I'm in London. I would recommend this restaurant to all my family and friends.

jOmaYHJHfq2SMHmol4gwdw.text: Have a good meal with hubby on our first day in London. The decoration is nice and the food is so good. Must try the duck and waffle and the banana waffle. We had a good time here.

3gSmkwR1qwNT3x46y3ImnA.text: The food here was amazing. Service was friendly, quick and efficient. Had the eponymous duck & waffle - duck was crispy, waffle was fluffy and egg on top had just enough runny yolk. Also had the chips cooked in duck fat - highly recommend these. Light and crispy and super flavorful. Also at the table we had a couple duck schnitzels - light and crispy on the outside and tender and juicy on the inside. And also a duck burger - which I didn't get to taste because it disappeared too quickly. For being so close to a touristy spot like Piccadilly Circus - they do really good good here!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. The Duck & Waffle

1j75K21oyPMzrYkVZDy-Aw.text: What an experience it's just the place, that it is breath taking, the delightful food,  the service is Outstanding ... definitely recommended !

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

fIkPKgUiHL_FNJlw8jqP8A.text: Just a place with some view...if you were not looking for the taste of food but some photography opp from the high floors, then go for it.

kceeq78T9JIgSuH2HUXAbA.text: This new restaurant is excellent.  Friendly staff and above all delicious food!  Duck and Waffle is a must try. Rosemary chips in duck fat.  Oh so crispy and are awesome even at the end of your meal.  We went for the duck burger too. Juicy and knocks the socks off any of the local burgers round here.  Cocktails on Tap and a cool looking bar area.  The order before you're seated means come prepared and check out the menu before hand.  Dessert of ice cream and waffle cones topped off a superb dins!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

oCK4oDi1uX13zB-VM_QHXA.text: It's a bit scary that they don't let me bring my water bottle in there so I had to threw it away. I understand that rule is rule. I'm just salty because I just bought that water bottle a week ago. This place is apparently very popular on Chinese websites. I saw quite many Asians when I went there. The staff was not familiar with the ethnic names so I had to deal with an uncomfortable situation when the staff thought I did not make the reservation. The restaurant is located on a very tall building. They have one elevator with window. Be aware if you're afraid of heights! The rosemary and garlic bread and the strawberry cocktail were okay. The duck and waffle and the octopus dish were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle. Even the egg is amazing.

qA80oFbEI79rWzUNYzr0Rg.text: Duck and waffle part deuce...After leaving the Theater Royal showing of The Goat,  I noticed the Duck n Waffle express.  Could it be???  Do I ??? Well I did needed a drink --so I doubled back and walked in.  Lovely atmosphere, music bosa nova chic, and the staff amazing!!!I expressed my anxiety with the maitre d and he said this location was different; slow casual and the food was great... Apprehensive, but I'm a second chance type of gal... First the duck gizzards arrived-tender bite size morsels chewy yet sublime.  Next a cocktail, the "breakfast fizzy" a citrus sensation--ice cold and just the right combination of sweet tart... Good show Watson the game is afoot!!!Next arrival the main course --Duck n Waffles--aromatic and tender nothing duckish here. The egg poached to perfection with a splattering of sea salt and a crispy waffle. Just like I'd heard-- it is trueRedemption is not a game but an art for Duck and Waffle Express. I adore your concept, but implore you to save the tower location, it's a muddy boot on your white alpaca carpet and you need to Blot that ish...

m3s_JZKjfDo2qKYs5csvGg.text: Omg food is amazing here!!! Wow. This place blew away my expectations. Yes it's a big name in London but I just thought it was touristy. I didn't think the food would be as good as it was. Definitely get the duck burger and the duck & waffle. Definitely...

gjw0bYUUwPT68KFOffEGmg.text: I love the original Duck & Waffle so I was really excited for the casual version. Located just away from the hustle and bustle of Piccadilly, the feel of the restaurant was great but it was surprisingly empty for a Saturday evening. We enjoyed the food but the service was a bit lacking.fried duck gizzardtwice cooked pork bao picked greens, cucumber chilli & peanutthe duck burger crispy duck leg, crushed noodles, miso mayonnaise & spiced slawvietnamese vegetable salad mint, coriander, nuoc cham dressing + crispy duck

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

tdHskvXvK5fS4WEq03IBhQ.text: The Duck & Waffle near Liverpool Street station can be difficult to obtain a reservation for a decent hour if you don't plan ahead well in advance. They still have open seating at the bar area, but only a very limited bar snack menu. You still get a chance to enjoy the view of London from 40 floors up, just no duck...only some sweet waffles.If all you really wanted to try, however, is the actual duck and waffle dish, Duck & Waffle Local is the way to go. No reservation needed, plenty of space, and comparatively cheaper for the same exact meal. In the now somewhat saturated space of chicken and waffles, duck and waffle was a nice small but luxurious twist on the dish. The duck was rich and flavorful, as expected, and the waffle was just as good as you'd expect it to be. Topped off with a fried egg and maple syrup, it wasn't too large of a meal but definitely left that sort of heavy brick feeling in your stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

wKjY1nnbjDolKovX2bA7ZA.text: I came her with a few friends after not being able to get into the original Duck & Waffle restaurant and were excited to try the food which is raved about online. If you are looking for the original fancier duck & waffle be sure to make reservations! I like duck and I like waffle. I've never had them together before but have had chicken and waffles and am a fan of that. After coming to Duck and Waffle, I am definitely a fan and wish there was one in LA!I was surprised to see that there was no wait when we arrived and the service was spectacular and very quick. We tried the foie gras creme brulee and that was a good appetizer, but the best part of the meal but I would order it again if I were to ever come back. I also tried the duck fat fries and the duck ears and would not bother ordering those again if I were to come back but they were neat to try.Now... onto the main courses. I ordered the duck burger with a double patty. I don't know what it was, but I felt like this was one of the best burgers I have ever had. If I could go back, I would get a single patty instead of the double as I feel it was be easier to eat and possibly better balanced. The combo of the perfectly cooked pattys, the duck juice, the crispyness of the dried ramen, it was just an awesome burger. I am getting hungry again just thinking of that burger!!I got a chance to try the duck and waffle as well and it was another delicious entree. With some chicken and waffle places, one of the complaints I've had is that sometimes the chicken gets dry at times and is not consistent. The duck here was flavorful and juicy and the waffle was cooked very well. It is a tough choice between the duck & waffle and the duck burger but you can't go wrong with either.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Foie gras creme brulee
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck & waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck burger

561orKo7H43ksNAwCbQ65Q.text: Came here for lunch while walking around the city. I got the duck waffle which was delicious- crispy duck and delicious syrup. The fruity iced teas are also amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

-Y6J2B6qiReGGcAiqBdLbA.text: Restaurant was nice and service was very good.  The Menu is primarily duck or duck fat.  We had  the duck and waffle and duck burger.  Interesting menu as we were visiting from US.  However, if I was a local, I think it would get old after 1 visit.

ud5Ju8jxJ36ahiAF12fPYw.text: We had reservations for the duck and waffle that was on the 40th floor but we weren't aware that kids under 21 were not allowed(my brother is still a teenager, hence why we weren't able to go to that location). We opted for this location instead. The wait staff were very welcoming and were friendly. Really wanted the creme brulee'd foie gras but they ran out of foie gras! Was utterly disappointed but I will be back for this. My mother and I split our dishes so we could try out the two popular dishes.Duck burger with ramen: duck, overall, had a nice savory flavor. I love how the skin was slightly crispy with the right amount of duck fat under. Delightful combo. Ramen kind of through the whole burger off. Was it really necessary to include it in the dish? Duck and waffles: I am a sucker for chicken and waffles but duck and waffles? Game changer. It's an upgrade by far. Duck is tender in both dishes. I love the maple syrup that they provide with your duck and waffles. Sweet but not overpowering. Pour it on the duck to get that pop of flavor of sweet and salty. Lovely combo.Duck neck: I can do without this dish. It was way too salty to peak my interest. Had one bite and I couldn't have another bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffles
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck burger with ramen

1XmmDkQrBH1kMB7PCVhkeQ.text: This is a good place to have some decent food. Plenty of space, service is fast, good atmosphere, music playing...I tried the Colombian egg... can't go wrong with that !

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

aT3pN8EOWXraqpZHQ1Jrgw.text: Loved the farmhouse decor.  Food was fun and unique.  I had the duck and waffle of course.  Duck was crispy and tasty.  Waffle was serviceable.  Service was nice and there's a bar.  It's a good place to eat if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

-PK1jbcJ5493k5F-klHWEg.text: We weren't able to get reservations to the actual Duck & waffle restaurant located on the 40 something floor.  So we decided to come to the local branch, which is cheaper and more casual.We're so glad to come here ! The foie gras crème brulee was amazing. I never thought you can make a savory crème brulee, but it worked! It's rich and creamy with a hint of sweetness due to the sugar glaze. It was plenty for the amount of bread that came with it. The duck fat fries were alright, not as flavorful as I expected. The duck ears tasted like chips and it came in a brown bag that looks like a packed lunch. I was not really impressed by it.I got the duck & waffle as the main course and it is absolutely better than the chicken & waffles from Roscoe's in America. My duck was still very moist and the waffle was perfectly crispy. Then you pour the syrup on top and it is the perfect dish. My fiance got the duck burger with double patty. To be honest, you taste more of the 2 beef patties than the duck. But it is still one good gourmet burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck & waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck burger with double patty
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

UqX5O-Jz9OPkkgwylQZVWA.text: Tasty food. We split the duck and waffle and the eggs benny.Super quiet when we went (April 9th about 8:30am)FriendserverNice decorGood area

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

Fv89NMCVqb-6KCX8jLNg4A.text: Wow, this place has great food. We got the duck fat fries, duck&waffle, and duck breast schnitzel. Hands down , the schnitzel for the win! Unbelievable. All the food was excellent, but...that schnitzel though. Light, perfectly fried, and served with a perfect salad on the side. Not a huge beer list, but they have a few great locals. The place is big, too, so you may actually get in here when mainstream SoHo let's you down. Do it! Great food and the service was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. The menu.

N4KG6UCSGzR2s-koLUpbLg.text: Tasty food in a comfortable setting close to Leicester Square and Piccadilly Circus.  Chose scrambled eggs on toast, and it just hit the spot.  Why I like this place was that there was enough room to enjoy my food without being squashed on a small table.  Noise level (during breakfast hours) was low, again, making my meal very enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Special eggs (think it was called Columbian eggs?).  Delicious.

VmRvKtlRGaoU3hLPepK9wA.text: This place was fantastic. I had wanted to try a traditional English breakfast and they certainly delivered. Very nice looking place and enjoyed eating at the table outside. Def recommend.

4kzbLC4Y2yvk9DcP5eDOzA.text: Went for lunch with a friend visiting from out of town, and we had a fabulous time. We all ordered duck and waffle, which never disappoints. The syrup was as tasteful as ever, and the duck, as succulent as I remembered it to be. We also had the fries on the side, which was flavourful and perfectly crispy. All our cocktails were great as well -- I really enjoyed my Duck and Stormy. Service was good and very prompt. They brought out orders without any delay and were efficient through the end. Ambience was casual and tasteful. Perfect place for a bit of calm and style in the hustle and bustle of Piccadilly Circus. I would return in a heartbeat!

RQp4YdqyaaAJNsfbd3i23Q.text: I expected more from this restaurant. The menu seemed limited and slightly different from photos posted at the other location. The service was crappy. It was a weird vibe in my opinion. The staff seemed rather slow in everything they did. I watched the guy prepare my dessert. He went from doing things around the kitchen to making our brownie waffle dessert... but he began without washing his hands or putting gloves on. Kind of lost my appetite after seeing that.Next time I would prefer to go to the other location. Overall, the food was good and the watermelon iced tea was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Watermelon tea
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Rosemary salted crisps

vOGd6odLtklcWnAwUGOcaA.text: Came here several times when we were in London. It was convenient - around the corner from our hotel, food was excellent, atmosphere was relaxed, and great background music. Tried and loved the duck and waffle, twice cooked pork bao, charred prawn roll, and local lager. Duck fat fries were great but did not love the rosemary salt sprinkled on them.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle and local lager

Yu0Vngke74xnKiefD47FVQ.text: Came here with a group of girls for dinner after hearing rave reviews. Im not normally an adventurous eater but i do love duck so i was so surprised they have so many different entrees with duck in it. Obviously we got the duck and waffles. The eggs were a bit overcooked. The waffles were good. Duck was tasty. We order a couple of different appetizers including the duck gizzards which were my favorite. Overall the food was good and the service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Sides
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Salad
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffles

4wQjaLkxH-NIyHaxpQSMog.text: Pricey food in the heart of Piccadilly Circus, but far from the prices of the original Duck & Waffle. My wife and I split a duck burger and fries. Added a second patty for some extra protein since we were sharing. That and fries was £20. It was absolutely delicious. The burger is a tower of a duck meat patty with some sliced pieces of dark duck meat (leg) on top. The sauce was good and a double patty burger and fries was good enough for us to share before the theatre. Duck fat fries were surprisingly tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

deaXAeEpo5kgE1UWNXJhLA.text: My first meal in London was a delicious success thanks to Duck & Waffle Local, the more casual, cost friendly version of London's 24 hr eatery Duck and Waffle. Good enough to inspire me to write my first review in years! My boyfriend and I split the duck jam doughnut, foie gras creme brûlée, the duck and waffle, and duck fat fries. All were delicious, but the two dishes one MUST get in my humble opinion would be the duck and waffle and foie gras creme brûlée. Words can't describe the exquisite combinations of flavors these two dishes provided, so just trust me on this and order them!Service was also fast and friendly. The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated and it didn't do too much damage to my wallet. All in all, it was a great way to kick start my Europe vacation and I have no complaints. 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck jam doughnut
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Foie gras creme brulee

OCD8DyX5O2BCzB9ZhrRnDQ.text: We tucked in during a thunderstorm only to find attentive staff & a creative menu. The mushroom ravioli does not have the signature duck ingredient but is delicious. The duck & waffle was exactly as you would hope, with a perfectly cooked duck egg on top. Great choice for lunch or a relaxed supper.

WawSBDfU7nkSKcZ8xXiLuQ.text: This was my last night in London meal and I'm so glad it was!I love duck. It's one of my favorite things to order when I'm in Europe because it's almost the same price as chicken. In the States, most places charge at least twice as much for duck. I also love chicken and waffles (it's usually what I have for my birthday lunch) so this restaurant seemed like the natural choice for my last night dinner. My partner was being a grump and said he didn't want to eat anything but would sit with me and have a drink. But once he got to the restaurant and saw the menu and the food on the other tables he caved and helped me eat all the delicious food.We ordered the duck & stormy, olives, duck and waffle, and the duck donut. Everything was delicious, but my favorites were the olives and duck and waffle. The staff was friendly and courteous.

MdRePRoE3iDMCC22pOJFmQ.text: Stopped by midday for a wine break, so I can't speak for the food (although the food around me looked delicious.)  I loved the interior of the restaurant.  At night when I passed by, it was bustling with people.Service is wonderful and the waiters/waitresses are friendly to tourists.  I really appreciated that!

DQTDeER7aSFYajj88CWKdw.text: I am a BIG fan of duck and Duck & Waffle really hit it out of the ball park for me. Back home in the U.S we are used to the Chinese Peking Duck and more traditional French duck dishes. When i saw this place on yelp my mind was completely blown. Duck & Waffle (5/5) Duck Confit over a perfectly cooked waffle and some sort of homemade maple syrup topped with a sunny side duck egg. Must get!! Duck was tender, almost fall off the bone and the runny egg was heaven since it helps offset some of the saltiness from the duck. Duck Fries (5/5) This was a first trying duck fries when I was here in June. Fried in duck fat, the fries had great texture and was perfect all on its own without any ketchup or sauces. Foie Gras Creme Brûlée (5/5)This was the dish I was crazyyyy about. I mean come on!! Creme Brûlée from Foie Gras?! So buttery and savory with a hint of the sugar, served with a buttry Roll topped with something i forget. This dish is genius and I wish they had this in San Francisco.... I still miss it til this day.Overall, MUST TRY in London. Service was spot on and servers are pretty tentative in filling your drinks and taking your plates away.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

mt1qS3X8Ir0Ktc-OVdVt9Q.text: I was so excited to try this place with all the unique options. We walk in and are promptly seated. There is a modern, airy feel to it with an open kitchen. They have wonderful (but pricey) cocktails on tap. Sadly I was a bit disappointed. I had the creme brûlée dish that had not much flavor at all. They tried to be savory and sweet but the texture and flavor weren't for me. The portion was small. The fruit in vinaigrette was amazing! Very unique. Our friend had the burger which looked (and was told) amazing. The pork and waffle was also a very small serving. Overall this place was meh. I think it's more the atmosphere that makes it what it is.

tNAfCCCWN_3AKysFRdZW-A.text: Traveled to London with 2 friends and I had this place bookmarked as a must eat because I love ducks. I've only heard of chicken of waffles, so duck and waffle was a must. We ordered 4 things: Vietnamese salad with crispy duck: The skin was crispy and duck was juicy and tender. The salad itself was phenomenal. It was very refreshing. I would definitely order it in the summer while sitting on the patio. It was definitely worth the extra $4 for the duck in my opinion.Duck and waffle: The waffle was very soft and chewy and the maple syrup wasn't super sweet. The duck's skin was crispy which was good, but the meat itself was dry. The duck was overcooked, so it was hard to chew. The egg on top made the overall dish look nice.  I stacked the duck, egg, and waffle together then dipped it into syrup so that I was able to taste the whole dish itself in one bite. Dry fried duck tongues: I've had duck tongues before, so I thought dry fried was an interesting way of making them. My friends and I thought the dish was way too salty. It wasn't dry at all and I think it's probably because of the sauce which made it wet and not so much fried even though it was really oily.Duck fat fries: It was so fatty and tasty. It came with ketchup and I think the white sauce was mayo. I love fries in general and I don't think it's possible to mess up fries. I'll definitely order fries again.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Vietnamese vegetable salad with crispy duck on the left, duck and waffle, dry fried duck tongues top middle, and duck fat fries top right

5PuOW-rcktLRj_eji6_8-g.text: Really happy that we stumbled across this modern, delicious restaurant. D&W is located in the middle of a ton of other restaurants, but it certainly offers something unique. The menu clearly specializes in duck, and it does not disappoint. By far, the Bao was my favorite dish. It was delightful. Followed close by the burger. We also enjoyed the broccoli, duck wings and fries (I think they have truffle on them so extra tasty and perfectly cooked). We ordered the gem salad and beets salad, which were also good (but clearly not as exciting as the other stuff). The service was wonderful and our waitress was very attentive and helpful. Overall, I'm thrilled we stopped in and I'd recommend to all.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Broccolini
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Bao (YUM!)
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Beets salad, gem salad and fries

BcKcGnOMN53DwJzzXUWTYw.text: I had the duck beni and it was delicious! 5 stars for the food but 3 stars for the service. After I was seated it took almost 10mins before a server handed me the menu. There were only 4-5 occupied tables so the slow service raised some eyebrows for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck beni

ILykc3PI7HBvAI1vmrtRGQ.text: The duck, waffle and egg combination was amazing topped of with the fries.... hmmmm heavenly. A must visit and try out their whole menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

BgmYfr7FUBPeQMMflkPbPA.text: Despite the Piccadilly area being one I try to avoid due to heavy foot traffic, this place is worth fighting through the crowds. Their duck Eggs Benedict (crispy duck skin, two eggs, hollandaise sauce on waffles) was probably one of the best tasting things I've eaten in a long time. Even when I show up with a large group, the wait time isn't terrible and the staff is still on top of their game. I recommend the duck creme brûlée as a side for the Eggs Benedict. Also killer. I would recommend passing on the duck donut. It sounded good but in comparison to everything else, sort of fell short.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck donut
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck eggs Benedict

T__rd6-VRBADPenPv9V_MA.text: After googling and searching for a brunch/lunch place to eat nearby, I came across this location. I like duck so why not try it?We ordered the duck burger and duck and waffle. This is a hipster, trendy place - reminds me of a local spot that'll they'll have in SF. It definitely has that feeling. It's open and spacious as well. So on a nice day if you wanted to enjoy the outside, you can sit on the patio side. I enjoyed my duck burger, and duck + waffle. The portions are a little smaller and pricier than I would like but everything was pretty good. We also had a side of duck fries, I enjoyed it but in my opinion, it could be have more duck flavor.

Rdac4JVmp8gTfueQBEd09w.text: Everything was EXTREMELY salty to the point I had to gulp water between every bite. Was ultra disappointed at the fried duck tongue. It was salty beyond belief and dry as well (each bite was just fried salty crisp and bone--couldn't taste any tongue flavor). Creme brulee was good in flavor, but too salty as well. The saving grace was broccolini, but that was drenched in salt and sauce as well.  Would not recommend--please take your money elsewhere. Overpriced and underdelivered.Update: At the end of the meal I complained to the manager about how ridiculously salty the duck tongue and creme brulee were and she talked back to me and accused me of lying.  She said "why did you eat 80% of the food"? I responded "because I was trying to force myself to eat it." And she kept insisting I was trying to eat without paying because I "ate 80% of the food." And I should have complained after the first bite.In my culture, you eat what's in front of you even if you don't like it, because someone worked hard to prepare it. That's why my friend and I tried eating the whole dish, but we couldn't down the extreme saltiness.  That's why we couldn't take it and finally I complained.Very unprofessional manager. She insisted I was lying to get free food. Extremely disappointed. Please don't bring your business to such a hostile restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Salty broccolini and fairly tasty burger.  Duck in the burger was dry.
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Salty duck tongue, and salty creme brulee

6lps2Kf7u1jp9Ytx6ZpP6Q.text: Duck, Duck, ......DELICIOUS!  We stopped by for lunch just before the place filled up, and the staff sat us outside on a perfect London morning. The menu offers so many options and my group tried the Duck Schnitzel with Duck Egg, egg breakfast, chicken with spices and polenta, duck fat fries l, and delicious chorizo.  This is a great option for a different kinda of meal right around the corner from piccadilly circus.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom

53rjjMAoA4KcW1ZpdS1Q0g.text: They had me a happy hour.We made an impromptu stop in here for happy hour and this was a great choice. They have several beverages for 5 pounds and bites for 3 pounds.Initially we were seated by the Hostess but then realized that we needed to be seated at the bar for what we wanted.With 15 minutes left on the happy hour clock, I decided to have the duck fat fries and 2 duck and stormy beverages.The fries were seasoned well with lots of herbs and not greasy at all. The only complaint for the drinks is that there wasn't enough time for me to order another.Our barista was friendly and made sure that we had everything that we needed. The establishment itself is nice and casual. I love that they had old school American tunes in the background adding to the ambience. The decor is simple, clean and modern. This seems to be a great meet me spot for mates and coworkers.I could definitely see myself being a regular here if I lived here. Should you find yourself near Trafalga Square or Picadilly Circus, this place is but a short stroll away. Check it out.

jDgpj8HiASt645C4qIW1Aw.text: The food was immaculate.  Fluffy waffles with crunchy corners, perfectly encrusted hazelnuts and banana, none of it overtly sweet.  The yogurt tasted fresh and the honey comb in it was divine.  The fresh mint tea was light on flavor even after steeping for 10 minutes.All in all, a delicious stop worth taking.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Left: Banana hazelnut waffle with vanilla ice cream.  Right: Yogurt with honey comb and pollen.

uBVdR5NSfWBYwBYxpi5Qbg.text: Duck & Waffle Local was a very pleasant surprise. My entire family loved the restaurant. I ordered the eggs benedict and it was superb: well-cooked, well-presented, and flavorful. I normally don't take pictures of food, but I had to take a picture of this one. The waffle was good, though I typically like waffles that are on the crispier end of the spectrum. If I'm ever in London again, I would probably come back for breakfast/brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict with Duck & Waffle!
Photo of Duck & Waffle Local - London, United Kingdom. Duck Burger

Dwt3im6n3pPSZinwWxRQAw.text: I'm in London for 2 weeks and I ate here twice. Duck has crispy skin but still tender on the inside. Waffle is good too but I prefer it to be crispier. Still this is one good plate of food worth coming back to.

5CsuMV_MBV4eMYBweOuvKw.text: Follow the giant red duck on the patio for a top notch selfie and a decent meal down the block from picadilly circus. Given the name, we felt obliged to order the duck and waffle  and we were glad we did. The waffle alone was delicious, soft and airy, and matched the duck perfectly. It comes with a nice big fried egg atop. The herb chicken with cheesy polenta was decent, and you can never go wrong with duck fat fries. Solid service, too, and although you will have to pay if you want water, it is bottomless and they keep it coming.

L-JyNljUhfnV2DwA3j193w.text: Foigras cream brûlée was unbelievable.   Bacon wrapped dates were good.   Enjoyed the duck schnietzel...

EAYxGxc5UIvSyk89KrnL2Q.text: Love to eat duck? Then this place is a must visit when in London! We initially wanted to eat at the original Duck & Waffle, but since they were booked, but we opt for this location and I'm glad we did! FOOD: Although, Duck & Waffle Local has a limited menu of the original Duck & Waffle, it has most of the popular items at this location. They also have non-duck items such as steak and veggies on their menu. We ordered: + Duck & Waffle: half a Belgium waffle, with duck thighs and sunnyside egg paired with maple syrup with poppy seeds! The waffle was nice and crispy on the outside and fluffy in the inside. The thigh wasn't too oily, nice and crispy and tender on the inside. The sunnyside egg was a great addition, since the runny egg yolk is good with pretty much anything. + Foie gras burlee: omg this was freakin amazing! If you are a foie gras fan, I highly highly recommend this! Imagine foie gras with crunchy sweetness added to it! The only suggestion I would add, is provide more bread, it's not enough for that much foie gras. We asked for more, and it was 1 pounds extra, which isn't too bad. + Steak: the seasoning was a little too salty and the greens it came with was too bitter for us , but other than that the steak was juicy and tender! SERVICE: It wasn't too busy when we arrived, so service was great! Very attentive and efficient. AMBAINCE: I really like the decor they have here! It has the vibe of a cozy barn.  Bathrooms are located downstairs to the right of the restaurant. Verdict: If I'm ever back in London, I would definitely come back and try their other items!

wmlAOiamfT6LbrlxS7leNg.text: Everything we ordered was very good! We ordered the wild mushroom ravioli, classic burger, roasted beetroot salad and tenderstem broccoli. My favorite is the roasted beetroot salad.... so refreshing! We also had the side of duck confit with our burger, something different but it paired really well with the burger. I'd definitely recommend this place if you're in the leicester square area
